props.synopsis: The former deputy leader of South Australia's Child Protection Department, believed to be the first Aboriginal person appointed to the role, has accused his former workplace of racism, claiming the agency told him it "owned" him for the duration of his contract.

title.children: Former SA Child Protection Department deputy says agency told him it 'owned' him

image.altText: A sign for Warrnambool Law Courts outside a modern building and metal fence

props.synopsis: A man is expected to be charged with murder after he was extradited to South Australia from Victoria in relation to the death of a woman at Mount Gambier.

title.children: Man extradited to South Australia over death of woman at Mount Gambier

image.altText: Birds eye view of coal mine

props.synopsis: Hundreds of workers at a coal mine owned by British billionaire Sanjeev Gupta have been stood down after suppliers refused to deliver critical materials over unpaid debts.

title.children: 'Anxious' workers at GFG Alliance mine stood down amid unpaid debts

image.altText: Large plumes of smoke rise from a fire burning across scrub land.

props.synopsis: The CFS said the fire posed no threat to life or property but remains uncontained.

title.children: Flinders Ranges bushfire destroys 20pc of national park in four days

image.altText: A group of young women planting plants in sand dunes with houses in background.

props.synopsis: A revegetation group that plants native species to the sounds of live music is launching its first fundraiser concert with hopes it becomes an annual event.

title.children: Young revegetation volunteers 'band together' for Adelaide mini-music festival

image.altText: A paper sign taped to a black fence telling people about a childcare centre being shut down

props.synopsis: Issues with cleanliness, fencing and a smell "that needs to be investigated" has led the state's education standards regulator to temporarily close a childcare centre in Adelaide's north.

title.children: Childcare centre temporarily closed to fix fence, flooring and smell

image.altText: An older man on a gurney is attended to on an airstrip.

props.synopsis: Ian Jackson was 80 kilometres away from the nearest medical clinic when he was bitten by one of the world's deadliest snakes. He was all alone — except for the voice in his head that told him to stay calm.

title.children: 'A bit of bad luck': 73yo back at work a day after eastern brown bite

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: A jury hearing evidence in a murder trial have watched CCTV of the incident and handled a semi-automatic rifle used in the alleged shooting murder of Steven Murphy in February 2023.

title.children: Jury examines semi-auto rifle and shown CCTV of alleged shooting murder

image.altText: Wurramara, a Black woman with short blonde hair, holds a sword above her head. She wears giant hoop earrings and gold armour.

props.synopsis: Emily Wurramara's already toured Australia off the back of her second album Nara, but she's heading out again — consider it a victory lap.

title.children: How a 1980s Tom Cruise fantasy flick shaped this ARIA-winning album

image.altText: Mavro, a black dog who is blind, has his head turned to the side and his mouth open.

props.synopsis: When Amy van Dyk noticed her pooch Mavro was 'running into things', she thought he was simply a clumsy puppy. She soon discovered he had a vision impairment — but that hasn't stopped Mavro from hiking, swimming and dog sledding.

title.children: From hiking to sledding, blind dog Mavro 'just keeps going'

image.altText: A lifejacket on a wooden jetty.

props.synopsis: A run of fatal and life-threatening incidents have highlighted the importance of wearing a life jacket, but differing rules around the country can cause confusion.

title.children: Life jacket rules differ throughout the country. So what are they?

image.altText: Nine players in whites and red caps hug and celebrate on a green field.

props.synopsis: South Australia currently sits on top of both the first-class and one-day competitions as it returns from the international break.

title.children: SA is in prime position to break 29-year Sheffield Shield drought

image.altText: British actor Henry Cavill

props.synopsis: The biggest names in Australia's film and television industry gather to celebrate the 2025 AACTA Awards on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Better Man, Furiosa lead early film winners as ACCTA Awards get underway

image.altText: The front of a vehicle parked in a bay with a prominent shiny T badge.

props.synopsis: Tesla sales have declined globally, including a 30 per cent drop in Australia this January. Experts say it's partly due to Elon Musk's political views and high-profile actions deterring buyers.

title.children: Tesla sales slump off the back of Elon Musk's alienating political views

image.altText: Brown water with a boat going past what looks like the roof of a pagola.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meterology is expecting more severe weather in north Queensland this weekend, while emergency services are focusing on accessing isolated areas running short on supplies.

title.children: Emergency flood warning issued for Giru in north Queensland

image.altText: A bearded man in a cap and sunglasses with a chain around his neck.

props.synopsis: Jonathan Wright ran his friend Paul Sia off a Queensland road in 2022 after an apparent drug deal went wrong. He stopped to collect cash strewn at the scene before he fled.

title.children: Life in prison for man who ran down and murdered friend

image.altText: Journalists come up with plan to stop job cuts at the Newcastle Herald and Illawarra Mercury.

props.synopsis: Australian Community Media plans to move all mastheads, including Newcastle Herald and Canberra Times, to one print publication a week as it adapts a new publishing model.

title.children: Newspaper publisher ACM plans to cut all mastheads to one print edition per week

image.altText: A person stands on the top of Mount Wellington wearing warm clothes.

props.synopsis: Tasmania is the "healthiest" place to live, according to a new study. But while the island's state government is keen to draw attention to the result, experts are cautioning against reading too much into it.

title.children: Australia's 'healthiest' place to live result needs a closer look, say experts

image.altText: Sam Kerr is seen gesturing towards a body camera inside a police station

props.synopsis: Police body cam footage of the arrest in London of Matildas star Sam Kerr is released as Ms Kerr and her fiancee Kristie Mewis give evidence in the high-profile trial.

title.children: Full body cam footage released as Sam Kerr denies using 'whiteness' as an insult

image.altText: A smiling young man with reflective sunglasses on his head.

props.synopsis: A Busselton woman has been found guilty of unlawfully killing a 25-year-old man and seriously injuring two others in a horrific crash in Western Australia's South West in 2022.

title.children: 'Nothing short of a tragedy': Woman found guilty of 25yo man's death

image.altText: A masked person holding a sledgehammer and a head severed from a statue.

props.synopsis: Police say images circulating online that appear to show busts of past prime ministers stolen from Ballarat Botanical Gardens indicate the "thinking capacity" of those responsible is "fairly low-end".

title.children: Vandal photographed with head severed from statue of PM

image.altText: The front of the Jewish Museum and War Memorial.

props.synopsis: A magistrate describes the alleged display of a flag with a Nazi swastika near Sydney's Jewish Museum and War Memorial as "disgraceful, disgusting and abhorrent".

title.children: Men accused of 'disgraceful' display of Nazi flag near Sydney Jewish Museum

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: Max King stands with his hands on his hips

props.synopsis: Max King, Jack Sinclair and Mason Wood have all suffered injuries and been sent for scans after a training session at St Kilda.

title.children: Training ground carnage as Saints trio injured

image.altText: Generic AFP Badge

props.synopsis: A 33-year-old Melbourne man has been charged with allegedly making death threats and antisemitic comments to a federal MP.

title.children: Man charged over death threats, antisemitic abuse of MP

image.altText: A golden pager mounted on a wooden plinth with an inscription from Benjamin Netanyahu to Donald Trump .

props.synopsis: The gift is the latest sign of the close ties between the US and Israel, which used exploding pagers to target Hezbollah personnel in the lead-up to last year's invasion of Lebanon.

title.children: Israeli PM gifts Trump gold pager, in apparent reference to attacks on Hezbollah

image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government is set to introduce legislation next week to enable Corrections to source prison guards from private companies and interstate, as inmate numbers reach a new record.

title.children: Private prison guards to help staff NT jails as inmate numbers surge

image.altText: A bald man wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Outgoing ABC chief content officer Chris Oliver-Taylor has claimed he didn't know radio presenter Antoinette Lattouf's race before her alleged unlawful termination, despite sending an email detailing her Lebanese background to the broadcaster's managing director, a court has heard.

title.children: ABC executive says he felt 'pressure from above' before Lattouf's radio exit

image.altText: A close up of a Fiji rugby shirt

props.synopsis: Fiji has fired director of rugby Laijipa Naulivou, a former women's national team captain, after she said there was a "gay problem" in a newspaper interview.

title.children: Fiji director of rugby sacked after 'gay problem' comment

image.altText: A bucket of black snakes.

props.synopsis: More than 100 venomous snakes have been captured in a backyard in Sydney's west in what snake catchers said was their biggest find ever.

title.children: Nest of 102 venomous snakes discovered in Sydney backyard

image.altText: A mid-shot of Ben Dawkins sitting in WA's Legislative Council looking up to his left.

props.synopsis: An analyst says Ben Dawkins's name change to Austin Trump is an "effective" publicity stunt and a potential vote winner.

title.children: Outcast WA politician changes name to 'Aussie' Trump ahead of state election

image.altText: A headshot of a man with long, silvery hair.

props.synopsis: Police are scouring dense bushland for a gunman wanted over an attempted murder in Tallebudgera Valley yesterday.

title.children: Police hunt for fugitive after homemade gun used in Gold Coast shooting

image.altText: A young woman is taking a selfie with her two young kids and her husband.

props.synopsis: Frankie Jane Green and her family have to "share an address" with friends to meet school enrolment requirements while they search for a permanent home.

title.children: Family living in caravan fakes home address to enrol child in school

image.altText: Anti-cable car protesters erect a sign up a mountain.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government says its proposed changes to planning laws will "prevent baseless objections" to developments from "well-funded activist groups and anti-everything organisations" — a move labelled by critics as "undemocratic".

title.children: Move to oust 'anti-everything' groups from planning process condemned
